books.author: by Megyn Kelly
books.description: The anchor of Fox News’s “The Kelly File” discusses why she left a succesful career as a lawyer, the value of hard work, the personal and professional challenges she has faced.
books.name: SETTLE FOR MORE

books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The host of “The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the final years of World War II.
books.name: KILLING THE RISING SUN

books.author: by Bernie Sanders
books.description: The Vermont senator and former candidate for the Democratic nomination for president delivers his message. of social and economic justice.
books.name: OUR REVOLUTION

books.author: by J.D. Vance
books.description: A Yale Law School graduate looks at the struggles of the white working class through the story of his own childhood in the Rust Belt.
books.name: HILLBILLY ELEGY

books.author: by Anna Kendrick
books.description: Autobiographical essays by the young actress.
books.name: SCRAPPY LITTLE NOBODY

books.author: by Andy Cohen
books.description: The further adventures of the TV producer and personality.
books.name: SUPERFICIAL

books.author: by Chip Gaines and Joanna Gaines with Mark Dagostino
books.description: The lives of the couple who star in the HGTV show “Fixer Upper.”
books.name: THE MAGNOLIA STORY

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the comedian, now the host of “The Daily Show,” whose birth was the result of an illegal (under apartheid) relationship between a white Swiss father and a black Xhosa mother.
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by Ron Chernow
books.description: A biography of the first Treasury secretary. Originally published in 2004 and the basis of the Broadway musical.
books.name: ALEXANDER HAMILTON

books.author: by Brian Kilmeade and Don Yaeger
books.description: The war against the Barbary pirates in 1801.
books.name: THOMAS JEFFERSON AND THE TRIPOLI PIRATES

books.author: by Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jeremy McCarter
books.description: The libretto of the Grammy-, Tony- and Pulitzer Prize-winning musical, annotated by its creator, along with backstage photos and interviews with the cast.
books.name: HAMILTON: THE REVOLUTION

books.author: by Arlie Russell Hochschild
books.description: The Berkeley sociologist interviews members of the Tea Party in Louisiana.
books.name: STRANGERS IN THEIR OWN LAND

books.author: by the Dalai Lama and Desmond Tutu with Douglas Abrams
books.description: A discussion between two spiritual leaders about how to find joy in the face of suffering.
books.name: THE BOOK OF JOY

books.author: by Ta-Nehisi Coates
books.description: A meditation on race in America.
books.name: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME
